page.title: 07The Playgroup in Laverstock.
page.content: In 1965 the playgroup was run privately in Elm Close, in a house, by Miss Higgs. From 1970-78 Mrs. Baggley took over. Now the playgroup is run by a committee of mothers. Mrs. Owen is employed as the supervisor. The play group is affiliated to the NPGA and takes children of ages 3-4, with about 20 pupils per day except Thursdays which is 'Mum and Todlers morning'. The aim is to teach the children manners and to get them used to being without their mums for a few hours. They are also taught basic reading and writing. Birthdays are special occasions for the pupils when they have a party. Every week includes something different making use of usual art/craft activities. Help is given by pupils from the local Girls Secondary School. There is a close link with the local Primary School.
